Legal_Issue: Procedural fairness due to delay and insufficient reasoning
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Section 4
Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (IRPR), Rule 17
Outcome: Application allowed, decision set aside, case referred for redetermination
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's marriage history and fluctuating relationship representations raised doubts about genuineness
Basis_of_Claim: Marriage not genuine or entered primarily for immigration purposes
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Complex immigration history, inconsistent representations, procedural delay
Legal_Standard: Section 4 of IRPR prohibits recognition of non-genuine marriages; procedural fairness required
Application_Factor: Timing of decision, reliance on memory, completeness of tribunal record
Decision_Review_Issue: Delay in decision, adequacy of reasons
Cause_of_Refusal: Doubts about marriage genuineness, procedural unfairness due to 10.5-month delay
Procedural_Fairness: Breach due to 10.5-month delay between interview and decision
Procedural_Issue: Delay in rendering decision, incomplete reasoning
Omission_Type: Failure to provide timely decision with adequate reasons

Crimes.Crime_Name: Misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Legal_Issue: Procedural fairness due to 10.5-month delay between interview and decision
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) s. 4
Outcome: Application allowed, decision set aside, case referred for new assessment
Credibility_Assessment: Marriage genuineness questioned due to prior immigration attempts and inconsistent representations
Basis_of_Claim: Marriage not genuine, misrepresentation in application
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Delay affecting reliability of officer’s recollection, credibility concerns
Application_Error: Reliance on memory after long delay, inadequate analysis of marriage genuineness
Review_Outcome: Motion dismissed, application allowed with referral
Legal_Standard: IRPA s. 4 – marriage must be genuine; procedural fairness requires timely decisions
Application_Factor: Officer relied on notes and memory after 10.5 months
Decision_Review_Issue: Delay impacting procedural fairness and decision quality
Cause_of_Refusal: Questioned marriage genuineness, procedural unfairness from delayed decision
Evidentiary_Issues: Officer’s recollection weakened by time lapse
Procedural_Fairness: Breach due to 10.5-month delay affecting fairness
Credibility_Issues: Inconsistent relationship representations, history of immigration attempts
Omission_Type: Failure to issue timely decision with contemporaneous analysis
